body:
I'm having some trouble using spack on the NERSC edison platform (a cray machine).

```
amklinv@edison02:~/spack/bin> ./spack compiler find
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./spack", line 98, in <module>
    import spack
  File "/global/u1/a/amklinv/spack/lib/spack/spack/__init__.py", line 72, in <module>
    import spack.repository
  File "/global/u1/a/amklinv/spack/lib/spack/spack/repository.py", line 45, in <module>
    import spack.config
  File "/global/u1/a/amklinv/spack/lib/spack/spack/config.py", line 307, in <module>
    _platform = spack.architecture.platform().name
  File "/global/u1/a/amklinv/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/lang.py", line 187, in __call__
    self.cache[args] = self.func(*args)
  File "/global/u1/a/amklinv/spack/lib/spack/spack/architecture.py", line 530, in platform
    return platform_cls()
  File "/global/u1/a/amklinv/spack/lib/spack/spack/platforms/cray.py", line 49, in __init__
    conf = spack.config.get_config('targets')
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'config'
```

I get a similar error message if I try to install anything.  Any advice on how to proceed?
title: trouble using spack on NERSC edison platform.
